column4: Hi, I have an ftp server running on my machine, but im not sure how to stop it, ?
I get the error :  ftp: unrecognized service
i know an ftp server is running on port 21 though, it shows up in nmap, and i can log in with ftp clients from other machine
i want to change it to something more secure, i heard ftp needs to die
look in /etc/init or /etc/init.d  for ftp and use that to stop
sftp != ftp, its a own protocol based on ssh
edit /etc/inetd.conf and disable the ftp thingy
thanks, i have commented out the line with ftp,  is there a way to stop the server though?
or just purge inetd if you don't use it for other things
i hate upstart ... sudo killall -HUP inetd
if you don't use inetd for other services, you should remove it
